creditline: Gift of Lisa and David Erickson
description: nude female figure crouching, facing R, wearing sandals; bobbed brown hair; framed
image_copyright: © Sir William Russell Flint %2F Russell Flint Family
medium: Red and brown chalk on paper
provenance: Joseph E. Dietzgen, Cotuit, Mass.; estate of Joseph Dietzgen; Lisa D. Erickson, M.D., Minneapolis
signed: signed in red chalk, near feet: W. Russell Flint | title in pencil, LRC: Lavinia in Sandals
text: Sir William Russell Flint was among the most prominent British Artists of the 1900s. He made his reputation with watercolors that were reproduced as illustrations in books of classic poetry and literature. The red chalk profile view of a squatting woman wearing nothing but sandals is identified as Olivia. This is probably a study for a scene from Virgil's Aeneid. Lavinia was the last wife of Aeneas.
title: Lavinia in Sandals
